Actions to Take Prior to Authorization When the Amount of a Veteran’s MRP Is Unknown
Follow the instructions in the table below
immediately prior to
authorization of an award to a Veteran when the amount of MRP to which the Veteran is entitled is unknown.
Step
Action

Follow the instructions in the table below.

Contact CGRASB at 866-772-8724 and ask whether the amount of the Veteran’s MRP has been calculated.

If
yes

ask CGRASB for the amount(s) and the effective date(s) of payment(s) of MRP
document the information obtained from CGRASB on

27-0820, Report of General Information
, and upload the form into the Veteran’s electronic claims folder (eFolder)
update the RETIRED PAY tab on the MILITARY PAYMENT INFORMATION screen in the award-processing system based on information CGRASB provided, and
disregard the remaining steps in this table.

Access RCPS by logging into the

.
5
Once RCPS opens, enter the following text in the upper, left-hand corner of the screen:
HUNT
[enter a space
or
comma, the Veteran’s nine-digit SSN, and a comma]

Example

HUNT 999999999,ENTIT

yes

Follow the instructions in

Pay compensation in accordance with the instructions in

no

request the Veteran’s retirement orders through DPRIS to confirm the Veteran retired
upload the orders into the Veteran’s eFolder when they arrive
, and
follow the instructions in
Step 2
of the procedure outlined in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart ii, 4.B.3.b
.
Notes
:
In order to gain access to RCPS, users must navigate to the
Military Pay
webpage and follow the access request instructions found in the
DRAS AMPS Guide – External User – Physical Security Guide
.
Upon completion, the access request is automatically routed to the following individuals/destinations, in sequential order:
the user’s immediate supervisor
the information security officer or human resource (HR) office, and
DFAS.
User guides for supervisors and information security/HR officers are also available on the
Military Pay
webpage.
When necessary, users may
reset RCPS by pressing the
Pause/Break
key on the keyboard, or
unlock a frozen RCPS screen by pressing the
Esc
key on the keyboard.
Do not log out of the DISA MIAP in order to maintain access throughout the day.
Claims processors may also obtain RCPS data by contacting DFAS via telephone at 1-866-622-4602.
References
:  For more information on using
RCPS, see the
Hunt User’s Guide
, and
DPRIS, see the
DPRIS User Guide
.
